description: Node.js is a JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 JavaScript engine that allows JavaScript to run on the server-side.

topics.title: Node.js Installation and Setup
topics.english: Install Node.js and set up development environment.
topics.hinglish: Node.js install karein aur development environment set up karein.
examples:
# Check Node.js version
node --version
# Check npm version
npm --version

practice.question: How to verify Node.js installation?

topics.hinglish: npm ya yarn ka use karke dependencies aur packages manage karein.

# Install package

# Install dev dependency

practice.answer: Configuration file containing project metadata and dependencies

practice.question: How to export multiple functions?
practice.answer: module.exports = { function1, function2 };

topics.title: ES Modules (import/export)

topics.hinglish: Modern JavaScript module system ke liye ECMAScript modules.

topics.title: Global Objects - process

topics.hinglish: process object current Node.js process ki information aur control provide karta hai.

topics.hinglish: Buffer class binary data ko directly handle karti hai.

practice.question: When to use Buffer?

practice.question: How to create custom events?

topics.hinglish: Asynchronous operations handle karne ke liye callback functions.

practice.question: What is callback hell?
practice.answer: Nested callbacks making code hard to read and maintain

topics.title: Asynchronous Programming - Promises
topics.english: Promise objects represent eventual completion of async operations.
topics.hinglish: Promise objects async operations ke eventual completion ko represent karte hain.

practice.question: Promise states?

topics.title: Asynchronous Programming - async/await
topics.english: async/await syntax for cleaner asynchronous code.
topics.hinglish: Cleaner asynchronous code ke liye async/await syntax.

practice.question: What does async function return?
practice.answer: Always returns a Promise

topics.title: Core Modules - fs (File System)
topics.english: fs module provides file system operations.
topics.hinglish: fs module file system operations provide karta hai.

practice.answer: Sync methods block execution, async methods use callbacks/promises

topics.title: Core Modules - path
topics.english: path module handles and transforms file paths.
topics.hinglish: path module file paths handle aur transform karta hai.

practice.question: Why use path.join() instead of string concatenation?
practice.answer: Handles different OS path separators automatically

topics.hinglish: os module operating system se related information provide karta hai.

topics.english: util module provides utility functions.

practice.question: What does util.promisify do?
practice.answer: Converts callback-based function to promise-based

topics.english: Create HTTP server using http module.
topics.hinglish: http module ka use karke HTTP server create karein.

practice.question: How to handle incoming requests?

topics.hinglish: req object properties ka use karke request details access karein.

practice.question: How to access request body?

topics.hinglish: URLs parse karein aur query parameters manually extract karein.

practice.question: What's the difference between URL and querystring modules?
practice.answer: URL module parses entire URL, querystring handles query string only

topics.hinglish: res object methods ka use karke responses send karein.

topics.hinglish: Client ke roop mein HTTP requests make karein.

practice.question: When does request actually get sent?

topics.hinglish: http.get() ka use karke simplified GET request.

topics.hinglish: http.Agent ka use karke persistent connections manage karein.

practice.question: Benefits of keep-alive connections?

topics.english: Create TCP server using net module.
topics.hinglish: net module ka use karke TCP server create karein.

practice.question: TCP vs HTTP server?
practice.answer: TCP is low-level transport protocol, HTTP is application protocol on top of TCP

topics.title: TCP Client with net module
topics.english: Create TCP client to connect to servers.
topics.hinglish: Servers se connect karne ke liye TCP client create karein.

practice.question: How to handle connection errors?
practice.answer: Listen to 'error' event on client socket

topics.title: UDP with dgram module
topics.english: Create UDP server/client using dgram module.
topics.hinglish: dgram module ka use karke UDP server/client create karein.

practice.question: UDP vs TCP?

topics.hinglish: Readable streams consumption ke liye data produce karte hain.

practice.question: What are the stream modes?

topics.hinglish: Transform stream data ko modify karte hain jab wo pass hota hai.

practice.question: Difference between Duplex and Transform?

topics.hinglish: pipe() method ka use karke streams ko connect karein.

practice.question: What happens when destination stream is slower?

topics.hinglish: Data flow manage karein jab producer consumer se faster ho.

topics.hinglish: Testing ke liye HTTP requests mock karein nock ka use karke.

topics.title: Deployment - systemd Service
topics.english: Deploy Node.js app as systemd service.
topics.hinglish: Node.js app ko systemd service ke roop mein deploy karein.
examples:
# Create systemd service file: /etc/systemd/system/nodeapp.service
[Unit]
Description=Node.js Application
After=network.target

[Service]
Type=simple
User=nodeuser
WorkingDirectory=/var/www/nodeapp
Environment=NODE_ENV=production
ExecStart=/usr/bin/node /var/www/nodeapp/index.js
Restart=on-failure
RestartSec=10

[Install]
WantedBy=multi-user.target

# Commands to manage service
sudo systemctl daemon-reload
sudo systemctl start nodeapp
sudo systemctl enable nodeapp
sudo systemctl status nodeapp

# View logs
sudo journalctl -u nodeapp -f

practice.question: Why use systemd for Node.js?
practice.answer: Automatic restart on crash, logging, startup on boot

topics.title: Deployment - Docker Container
topics.english: Containerize Node.js application with Docker.
topics.hinglish: Docker ke saath Node.js application ko containerize karein.
examples:
# Dockerfile
FROM node:18-alpine

WORKDIR /app

COPY package*.json ./
RUN npm ci --only=production

COPY . .

USER node
EXPOSE 3000

CMD ["node", "index.js"]

# .dockerignore
node_modules
npm-debug.log
Dockerfile
.git

# Build and run
# docker build -t nodeapp .
# docker run -p 3000:3000 -d nodeapp

# Multi-stage build for smaller image
FROM node:18-alpine AS builder
WORKDIR /app
COPY . .
RUN npm ci && npm run build

FROM node:18-alpine
WORKDIR /app
COPY --from=builder /app/dist ./dist
COPY --from=builder /app/node_modules ./node_modules
COPY --from=builder /app/package.json ./
CMD ["node", "dist/index.js"]

practice.question: Why use alpine base image?
practice.answer: Smaller image size, better security with fewer packages
